entries.title: ‘Black Panther’ actor Tenoch Huerta named AP 'breakthrough entertainer'
entries.description: Tenoch Huerta, the Indigenous Mexican actor who plays the villain Namor in "Black Panther: Wakanda Forever," has been named an AP 'breakthrough entertainer.'

entries.title: Beloved Argentine soccer announcer Andrés Cantor 'overwhelmed' by World Cup call
entries.description: Telemundo soccer announcer Andrés Cantor discussed his emotional call Sunday announcing the final goal giving Argentina, his home country, the World Cup.

entries.title: Dutch prime minister apologizes for Netherlands’ role in slave trade
entries.description: In a speech at the National Archives in The Hague, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte formally apologized for the country’s history of slavery.

entries.title: Dutch leader apologizes for Netherlands’ role in the slave trade, establishes fund to grapple with slavery's legacy
entries.description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte apologized Monday on behalf of his government for the Netherlands’ role in slavery and the slave trade.

entries.title: Messi secures his status as a global icon after World Cup final for the ages
entries.description: Argentina's World Cup final win over France on penalty kicks helped seal Lionel Messi's status as one of soccer's greatest and an icon alongside Diego Maradona.

entries.title: Putin visits Belarus amid fears of fresh ground offensive in Ukraine
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin visited Belarus, an ex-Soviet ally, for talks with President Alexander Lukashenko amid fears over a fresh ground offensive in Ukraine. Moscow said suggestions of Belarus joining the war were “stupid and unfounded” but Russian forces used the country as a launch pad for attacks on Kyiv in the days following the invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: Iranian actress Taraneh Alidoosti detained amid ongoing protests, state media says
entries.description: Amid ongoing demonstrations across Iran, authorities have detained one of the country’s most famous actresses after she expressed solidarity with the anti-government protests. NBC News’ Ali Arouzi breaks down what charges Taraneh Alidoosti is facing and how protesters are reacting to her high-profile arrest.

entries.title: Video shows Russian strike on Kyiv energy infrastructure, authorities say
entries.description: Ukraine's emergency services released video on Monday claiming to show the aftermath of a Russian strike on energy infrastructure in Kyiv.

entries.title: China confirms its first Covid deaths in weeks
entries.description: Monday’s two Covid-related deaths were the first to be reported by China's National Health Commission since Dec. 3, after which the government relaxed strict anti-virus controls.

entries.title: China reports first Covid deaths in weeks as virus surges through Beijing
entries.description: China reported its first Covid-related deaths on Monday amid rising doubts over whether the official count was capturing the full toll.

entries.title: Historic biodiversity agreement reached at U.N. conference
entries.description: Negotiators reached a historic deal at a U.N. biodiversity conference early Monday. It is the most significant effort to protect the world’s lands and oceans.

entries.title: Search for survivors after Thai warship sinks in high seas
entries.description: Thai navy ships and helicopters were searching on Monday for more than two dozen sailors still missing more than 12 hours after a warship sank in rough seas overnight in the Gulf of Thailand.

entries.title: Mass shooting in Canada leaves at least 6 dead
entries.description: At least six people are dead after police responded to reports of an active shooter at a condo building in Ontario, Canada.

entries.title: 'They want to create fear': Struggling to crush unrest, Iran turns to public executions
entries.description: Iranian regime has started executing people in response to anti-government protests triggered by the death of Mahsa Amini.

entries.title: North Korea says latest launches tested 1st spy satellite
entries.description: North Korea said it fired a satellite in an important test for the development of a spy satellite, a key military capability coveted by its leader Kim Jong Un

entries.title: Watch: Huge crowds in Buenos Aires celebrate Argentina's World Cup win
entries.description: Tens of thousands of Argentine soccer fans packed into Buenos Aires’ 9 de Julio Avenue to celebrate their team winning the World Cup.

entries.title: 5 dead and suspect killed in 'horrendous' condo shooting outside Toronto
entries.description: Six people, including the suspect, are dead after a shooting at a condominium just outside Toronto on Sunday night.

entries.title: Putin heads for Belarus as Russian drones target Ukrainian capital
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin heads for Belarus on Monday, fueling Ukrainian fears of a new offensive as Russian drones attacked Kyiv.

entries.title: Thai warship sinks in rough seas; navy searching for 31 sailors
entries.description: Thai navy ships and helicopters were searching on Monday for more than two dozen sailors still missing more than 12 hours after a warship sank.
